intro: Wahlenbergia linearis, commonly known as the slender bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped flowers. The flowers are typically blue or purple, and they bloom in late summer to early autumn. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. It is also known for its ability to thrive in coastal environments.
